intro: Ervilia tetrasperma, commonly known as the four-seeded ervil, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical pods containing four seeds each. Ervilia tetrasperma is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some parts of its native range.
